description: Triangle T(n,k) = number of binary n-tuples u having exactly k grandchildren, where a grandchild is a vector obtained by deleting any two coordinates of u (n >= 2, 0<=k<=2^(n-2)).
references: N. J. A. Sloane, On single-deletion-correcting codes, in Codes and Designs (Columbus, OH, 2000), 273-291, Ohio State Univ. Math. Res. Inst. Publ., 10, de Gruyter, Berlin, 2002.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 2..15 of triangle, flattened
N. J. A. Sloane, On single-deletion-correcting codes
prog: (Haskell)a057607 n k = a057607_tabf !! (n-2) !! ka057607_row n = a057607_tabf !! (n-2)a057607_tabf =  [2] : map (0 :) a057606_tabf-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 30 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 08 2000
